Reviews.Title: “This Property is Closed”
Reviews.Author: roycharles
Reviews.Content: I arrived here after having had such a pleasant stay in 1984 with young children. I found the property closed. There was a uniformed security guard on the premises who allowed us to look around and reminisce. The property had great potential......I suspect that modern tastes have changed and this property no longer entices families. It was simply a little too primitive. The security guard told us that the property had been closed for about 9 months and was owned by "the bank". No point in describing more here. It would simply take too much money to put this place back into action.....no payback probable.

Reviews.Title: “This place is obviously now closed and in disrepair. ?Status”
Reviews.Author: curiousbooks
Reviews.Content: Thought folks should know that this place is no longer open. We hoped to stay at this parador, but we stopped by to find that the property is presently unattended and falling into disrepair. It's really too bad because the setting is beautiful. There was no contact information anywhere on the property and no "se vende" signs either, so we couldn't find out any plans the owners might have for the future.

Reviews.Title: “It has some really good qualities...and some bad”
Reviews.Author: Travis19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2007 with my Puerto Rican girlfriend when we went to visit her famiy. Her parents got us a 2 nights stay. It was very quiet and rustic. The food was great and the outdoor eating area had a wonderful view of the mountains. There are some good walking trails for exploring. We both liked it a lot and I even asked her to marry me while staying there, so it was a very special stay. Fast forward to 2010, we decided to go there for another 2 nights stay. It was a little busier this time, but not too loud. The first night we ate, they didn't have my first few choices off the menu. The second night, we went to the resteraunt and it was locked. I asked they lady at the desk and she said that they weren't going to be open because they didn't have many guest. We were told to drive to one of the towns to find food. My wife and I both thought they could have warned us, as it was already late and hard to make last minute changes when you have a baby. The rooms were fairly dirty on that second stay as well. Although it will always be a special memory of our engagement, we will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: PRtravelers602
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hacienda Juanita in January of 2003, our stay then was very nice, service was great and the rooms were charming. We used the old side of the hacienda and loved it, no television no phones, we got exactly what we went there for, REST. Fast forward to our stay in September 2010. The rooms are in shambles; the beds feel like they are made of rock and the pillows feel like flat tires. Service was terrible, only one employee at night to handle the office and the restaurant. This hacienda is a beautiful place full of nature and history, but until the owners do something to bring it back to what it was a few years ago, I would not recommend it. You will waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “What passed for faded charm is really just filth!”
Reviews.Author: Lindafm
Reviews.Content: This could have been a charming hotel but it is now dirty and unkempt. The rooms are filthy, the outside is unkempt, the pool was dirty, the tennis court was crumbling, and the restaurant was closed. There was absolutely nowhere close by to get a meal and the only alternative was a mini mart in town that sold sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place, this is a rat hole”
Reviews.Author: rra7184
Reviews.Content: Service was trouble, I checked in on 7/3/2010 and when I saw the room, I wanted to cancel. But it was too late. The maintenance of the swimming pool was trouble very dirty pool plus a whole area was dirty with empty cans and bottles, and the rest. the waiting was so long that I went to have breakfast and I ended up having lunch, they never had what the menu said, closed this place this is embarrassing for the people of Puerto Rico. I WONT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE, DONT WAIST YOU MONEY

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good choice”
Reviews.Author: iirizr
Reviews.Content: We live in Puerto Rico and we bought an offer for this Parador, we wanted a relaxing vacation enjoying the nature of our island, was disappointing. Although there are other very good inns in Puerto Rico this time we were wrong with this one. The road is difficult and long, many curves and no light pole on the road. The bathtub was disgusting, dirty and black. After using the toilet could not use it again after a while because had no water left in it and also in the sink. Our room had a leakage in the ceiling. The room had little light , was dark, can't imagine it at night. Had no A/C. We decided to go to another hotel (Holiday Inn in Mayaguez). Some years ago some friends visited this Parador and don't have any complaint, they did not have this experience, it is disappointing that no longer is in the same conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Coffee Plantation Landscape, Rustic, Comfortable, Clean and Insect Free!”
Reviews.Author: condoplayaazuliii
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 24 seniors taking an overnight tour into the coffee country of Puerto Rico by bus. The hacienda was our overnight accommodations, we experienced hospitality PLUS! We arrived in the late afternoon in time to freshen up, enjoy a great cup of coffee on the veranda, then enjoyed an exceptional dinner. Each ordered off the menu to their own diet requirements. After some cards in the lounge area we enjoyed a peaceful and restful night sleep. The seniors in the handicap rooms were delighted with the thoughtful accomodations - unheard of at most Paradores. Breakfast orders were taken the night before and was served early to us so we could continue on our tour., Breakfast was served hot, quickly, with great coffee and friendly service. We so enjoyed our stay and found the room rate that included our dinner and breakfast to be FANTASTIC & the staff was unbelievably helpful and friendly. Ours was a self organized tour and the Hacienda Jaunita experience made the overnight experience DELIGHTFUL! The thing we liked the least was we did not plan another night with our hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: finder45
Reviews.Content: We can live with rustic accomodations, especially since there are no other real choices in Maricao. The restaurant, however, was terrible. Five of our entree selections were not available. Then we're told for the first time that there was a $12.50 limit on dinner, which made the "includes dinner" advertisement a joke since most of the entree items exceeded the limit. Stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Rates at Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: Gypsygirl65
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hacienda. When we booked our room over the phone, we were told the rate "included dinner and breakfast." However, when we checked in, we were told there was a dollar limit on both meals. The price of most of the dinner entrees in the restaurant exceeded the dollar limit. In addition, the food and service at dinner was terrible. Their idea of a "special" was chicken nuggets. Breakfast was somewhat better, with better service, but terrible coffee, considering this is a coffee plantation. The Hacienda should be straightforward about its rates. This constitutes false advertisinig. It should also upgrade its restaurant fare and service.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed, Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Ceres148
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed in Hacienda Juanita for their honeymoon 27 years ago and I wanted for my parents to stay here again since I have never been here. Seems I will never be back. I got a 4 day/ 3 night offer which supposedly included breakfast , lunch and dinner. They never told me beverages weren't included and I had to pay extra for the aditional drinks. Desserts are also not included (another extra cost). There is a limit of $7 for breakfast and $12.50 for lunch/dinner and the prices of the food on the menu are more than the limit, so you are forced to pay extra always. Restaurant service is terrible. Tablecloths were all dirty and I noticed they were not changed for three days. The food is not of good quality and most of the menu items were not available which is extremely dissapointing. The second day of my stay front desk told me that lunch was from 12 noon to 2 pm and I arrived at 1:30. The waitress didn't want to take my order since the kitchen was closing in in 30 minutes and there were another orders before mine and there were no time to prepare mine. I was forced to eat the daily special which was a cold beef stew done since the morning.UNBELIVABLE!!! Pool was all dirty and 3 of the 5 arcades of the gaming room were not working. Housekeeping lady was very kind and nice to us (toilet paper was never missing). Bathrooms need refurbishing and no water pressure in the faucets. My offer was of $754 for the 4day/3nigh and I ended up paying over $900 because of the extras. This place its not worth the money, I will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but wouldnt come back”
Reviews.Author: SANDRANYC26
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at Parador Hacienda Juanita (Jun 21 2008) but the parador needs urgent repair: Positives: Beautiful Property /Perfect location Nicely maintained garden Good food Negatives: Rooms are in a desperate need of renovation, mainly bathrooms. Faucets /bathtubs need major refurbishment. Bathrooms in the restaurant area are total disgrace: broken faucets, smelly toilets / broken doors and lack of working soap containers as well as toilet paper Service: waiters need to work on multitasking better (a food order in an empty restaurant should not take one hour and 3-4 times remaining what needs to be brought up) I thoroughly loved the plantation but wouldnâ€™t recommend it to the friends and family given the lack of basic maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Colonial Rustic”
Reviews.Author: cas49
Reviews.Content: Overall I rate this hotel average. It is fairly dismal in some respects, and stellar in others. Service: The establishment seems understaffed. There were gaps in the published menu and what food was really available. The food service was often behind schedule in starting for breakfast or dinner, with slow service. The breakfasts were fairly good, but the dinners were just passable insofar as table fare is concerned. Accomodations: The pool is usable, but maintenance is poor. It is up to the guest to remove the leaves and insects floating on the surface. The water was clear and cool, and the pool is large enough for lap swimming. The rooms have no air conditioning, there are no insect screens on the windows, and the bathroom facilities are aged and in need of some repair. However, the facilities did work. Cleanliness was okay and the rooms were cleaned and serviced during my absence while I was on business in Maricao during the daytime hours. I recommend walking around the compound and selecting the cabin/room you will stay in, as some are near sources of noise (like gathering locations for local parties) and others are near hotel garbage storing sites located behind some cabins. Location: This is where the hotel shines. It is on a cleared hillside in the tropical forest. The immediate grounds have nice paths and little gardens. There is a path following the periphery of the compound clearing boundary with the forest that is maintained, allowing one to treck on the forest edge. The path leaves the compound grounds near an old coffee processing machine, circles down near the tropical forest for about a quarter mile or so, traverses along the lower slope of the compound hillside and circles up hillside to re-enter the compound near the kitchen building. There are all types of insects, spiders, birds and lizards. I found a spider that has defied classification for a year. There was also a lizard lying dead near the office steps with a spider in its mouth, an apparent dinner that did not go so well. A dead mongoose on the path provided testimony to the mammalian creatures inhabiting in the area. Atmosphere: This place is reminiscent of the 1800s colonial compounds seen in old pictures. The setting, especially when in the vicinity of the cabins immediately adjacent to the restaurant building, seems to bring one back in time to a pastoral society where life is slower and the bustle of the modern world is missing. For someone used to camping and seeking a rustic and secluded night or two with a real bed, running water and available services, this place is great. I worked in Maricao during the day, but had I the time, a great day could have been had with an early morning walk along the path (I did this), a day of reading and viewing from the restaurant building veranda and an evening swim (I did this) before retiring early. I would recommend bringing a good book or two and a pair of binoculars. This would allow a person to have two or three days of peaceful, introspective adventure.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of those places that you leave behind as soon as you can.”
Reviews.Author: RobertGiacommetti
Reviews.Content: I had been to this place about 15 years ago, and unfortunately, the place has become a dump. The ladies in the front desk could not have cared less about our arrival, and the second lady late in the day was more interested in her homework than in answering our questions. There was a small puppy that was way friendlier than the front desk attendants. The rooms are despicable: dark and musty. The bathroom is absolutely filthy. When I looked inside the bathtub I was totally disgusted. The food at the restaurant was very good, and the view is nothing to call home about.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Getaway”
Reviews.Author: srblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Hacienda Juanita for a brief honeymoon. It was secluded and took a while to get to, but it was very relaxing! The room we had was very basic but clean. We ate at the restuarant for all of our meals. Lunch and dinner were OK, but breakfast was great. The views from the restaurant and deck are wonderful, and we hiked the trail, which was a little overgrown but otherwise very nice. Since we went in the off-season, we had the place and the pool mostly to ourselves. There were flowers everywhere, along with a couple of pet turtles and chickens, but no excess noise. We originally were in a room next to screaming children, but the hotel changed it for us without any problems. I would recommend it when you just want to "unplug."

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cezzah
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, its so peaceful and relaxing. The staff and owners were all really nice, taking the time to chat with us over a drink and making us feel really at home. The rooms are pretty basic to be honest but they fit in with the surroundings - they feel like they belong in the setting and the hotel compliments rather than scars the beautiful landscape. Had some lovely food in the restaurant, all home made (I think by the owners mum) and authentic puerto rican dishes on offer. Great range of rums to try in teh bar aswell if I remember rightly. Sort of place you could happily hang around for a few days, just lounging reading books and chatting. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Juanita a Place to Rest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: People were great, Surrounding extra ordinary. bedrooms need a little improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Run For Your Life..............”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once you get there you may be welcomed by the coqui's beacause there isn't any staff to do so. When I made my reservation I was told that my room key would be left for me inside of my room because there wasn't any personel on staff at 10 PM. (I wasn't smart enough to get the hint!!) Once I get to my room at the roach motel after several minutes of searching for it. Yes my key was there along with the dirty room, but it was so late I didn't dare to leave. I was up at 6 AM due to the small and uncomfortable bed. When I left at 7 AM I had to leave the key in the room because once again there weren't any employees only to be contacted by the owners wife, Maria Elena, very rudley questioning me why I left so early and left empty cans in the garbage at the room. I felt very scared after this phone call. Please Don't Go There.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Roachita”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The grounds were nice but if you compare a room here with on at Motel 6, the Motel 6 would be a 5 star hotel. The bed was very very small and hard, the windows have no glass or screens to keep the bugs out except for wooden shutters. To compound the problem your only means of trying to cool off is a single fan. Do not open the shutters to get fresh air into your room or you will be eaten alive by the swarms of hungry mosquitoes! Oh, and if you have to get up in the middle of the night because of the crowing of the roosters, you better turn on the light and wait a couple of seconds before you make your way to the restroom to give the biggest roaches I have ever seen a chance to run off and hide. Puerto Rico is a great. If you want to see a coffee plantation take a trip to Hacienda Buena Vista. It is well worth it. Save you time and money (as it takes a lot of both if you stay here) and visit the islands many other wonderful places!

Reviews.Title: “A true jewel hidden in the mountains of P.R.”
Reviews.Author: Odc
Reviews.Content: This "Parador" was exactly what I was expecting. If you enjoy the fresh air of the mountains, the sounds of the "coqui" (small native frogs) at night and really good "creole" food...look no further. Even tough the driving is not a piece of cake, the peace that you'll find once you get there will make you forget all about it.

Reviews.Title: “Major disappointmnet.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No welcome upon arrival. Deserted grounds and sullen staff. Room stark & barren, no charm, with a desolete run-down feeling. Despite gastronomic claims, most items on menu were not available. Food we ordered did not fit menu discription. Service was abysmal. Pool dirty. Worst issue: Rooster started crowing at 11pm and continued until 7am, preventing sleep and prompting our immediate departure.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Juanita ...just made in heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just checked the hotel's web page at www.haciendajuanita.com , impressed by the guest comments and the fair rates I made a reservation for the past weekend. THIS PLACE WAS MADE IN HEAVEN...

Reviews.Title: “Found Paradise in Hacienda Juanita”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at Hacienda Juanita two years ago. It was my first trip to Puerto Rico, but my fiancee grew up there. I fell in love with this parador. It was so far removed from everday life. You wake up in the morning, open your window shudders and look out into a lush tropical forest. You can spend all day wandering around the grounds, going swimming, hiking trails, or laying in bed. They play festive music nightly, and the food is AMAZING. I can honestly say that it was the best food I have ever eaten. You can haveyour meals on their terrace which overlooks the tropical landscape, or you can eat in the main dining room or even have the food sent to your room. The service is excellent and the area is gorgeous. It has been two years since I was at Hacienda Juanita, and I can't stop talking about it!
